sub_topic: Finding the maximum flow in a network.
message_1:
Consider the following network graph:

```
Source --> A (capacity: 9) --> B (capacity: 7) --> C (capacity: 4) --> D (capacity: 11) --> Sink
         |                    |                    |                    |
         v                    v                    v                    v
         E (capacity: 8) --> F (capacity: 6) --> G (capacity: 8) --> H (capacity: 5)
```

Find the maximum flow that can be sent from the source to the sink through the network graph, and determine the flow along each edge that achieves this maximum.
message_2:
To find the maximum flow, we can use the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm. We will find augmenting paths and update the flow along the edges until no more augmenting paths can be found.

1. First, we find an augmenting path: Source -> A -> B -> C -> D -> Sink. The bottleneck capacity is 4 (the minimum capacity along the path). We update the flow along the edges:

```
Source --> A (9/9) --> B (4/7) --> C (4/4) --> D (4/11) --> Sink
         |                    |                    |                    |
         v                    v                    v                    v
         E (0/8) --> F (0/6) --> G (0/8) --> H (0/5)
```

2. Next, we find another augmenting path: Source -> A -> B -> G -> H -> Sink. The bottleneck capacity is 3 (the minimum capacity along the path). We update the flow along the edges:

```
Source --> A (9/9) --> B (7/7) --> C (4/4) --> D (4/11) --> Sink
         |                    |                    |                    |
         v                    v                    v                    v
         E (0/8) --> F (0/6) --> G (3/8) --> H (3/5)
```

3. Now, we find another augmenting path: Source -> E -> F -> G -> H -> Sink. The bottleneck capacity is 5 (the minimum capacity along the path). We update the flow along the edges:

```
Source --> A (9/9) --> B (7/7) --> C (4/4) --> D (4/11) --> Sink
         |                    |                    |                    |
         v                    v                    v                    v
         E (5/8) --> F (5/6) --> G (8/8) --> H (8/8) --> Sink
```

At this point, we cannot find any more augmenting paths. Therefore, the maximum flow is the sum of the flows into the sink, which is 4 + 8 = 12. The flow along each edge is as shown in the final graph above.
